text.section: The Kentucky Proud™ promotion fund is created in the State Treasury as a trust and agency account to be administered by the department for the purposes provided in this section.

Notwithstanding the provisions of KRS 45.229, any moneys accruing to this fund in any fiscal year, including state appropriations, gifts, grants, federal funds, interest, and any other funds both public and private, shall not lapse but shall be carried forward to the next fiscal year.

Moneys received in the fund shall be used for administrative expenses to support the Kentucky Proud™ Program, provide grants-in-aid, and other purposes and expenses related to promoting Kentucky-grown agricultural products.

law.history: Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 154, sec. 6, effective July 15, 2008.
